title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Bronte
description: A tale of passion and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors, exploring the complex relationship between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Jane Austen's romantic novel follows Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates issues of manners, upbringing, and marriage in early 19th-century England.

author: George Orwell
description: George Orwell's dystopian novel delves into a totalitarian regime where surveillance and propaganda suppress individual freedom.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: Harper Lee's classic addresses racial injustice and moral growth in the American South through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel captures the decadence and excess of the Jazz Age, focusing on the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bronte
description: The story of an orphaned girl’s quest for self-respect, love, and independence.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of Captain Ahab’s obsessive quest to kill the great white whale.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical epic that weaves together the lives of several families during the Napoleonic wars.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A teenager’s journey through New York City as he grapples with themes of identity and alienation.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological drama that explores morality, guilt, and redemption.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic tale of love and society, exploring the struggles of Anna Karenina against the backdrop of Russian aristocracy.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: The story of Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who creates a sentient creature, leading to catastrophic consequences.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A gothic novel about the vampire Count Dracula’s attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A tale of vanity and corruption, where Dorian Gray remains youthful while his portrait ages.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: The story of Pip, an orphaned boy, as he grows and navigates his ambitions, love, and self-discovery.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A historical novel that explores justice, love, and redemption in 19th-century France.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: The epic journey of Odysseus as he returns home from the Trojan War.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: The epic tale of the Trojan War, focusing on the hero Achilles.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel exploring morality, faith, and familial conflict.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: A historical novel set during the French Revolution, exploring themes of resurrection and transformation.
